content:
/>
V.iii.3.2.c
.
Incubation Periods of Tropical Diseases
The table below contains the incubation periods of some tropical diseases.
Tropical Disease
Incubation Period
dracontiasis (Guinea worm disease)
14 months
filariasis, Bancroft’s type
up to 8 to 12 months
kala-azar (visceral leishmaniasis)
up to one year
Hansen’s disease (leprosy)
five years or more
loiasis, calabar swelling
three years
oriental sore, Old World cutaneous leishmaniasis
up to 18 months
title: M21-1, Part V, Subpart iii, Chapter 3 - Infectious Diseases, Immune Disorders, and Nutritional Deficiencies
citation: Part V, Subpart iii, Chapter 3, Section None
